page.title: 10ECOLOGY in WESTMILL
page.content: When the sand and gravel has been worked out a large hole about 30metres deep remains. It is the responsibility of the company to fill this in and reconstitute the land back to farming use. Landfill undertaken by the company in this area involves filling in the holes with factory waste, building rubble and household refuse, anything as long as it is not liquid,hazardous waste which would poison the ground water. A thick layer of good topsoil is added and the land is sown with grass. This area is then grazed by sheep. Then an arable crop can be sown and after five years the gravel company can sell the reclaimed land back to the farmer. At Westmill, mature trees around the workings remain which effectively screen them from the attractive countryside.
